properties.Title: Weather Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Winter Weather Travel Advisory in effect for this afternoon due to snow squalls. Locally heavy snow squalls are forecast to develop early this afternoon. While these snow squalls are not expected to linger over any one area very long, locally heavy snow and reduced visibilities in blowing snow will make travel difficult at times. Up to 10 cm of new snowfall can be expected by the time the snow squalls move south of the area late this afternoon. Travelers should consider changing their travel plans accordingly. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-22T01:47:19-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-21T09:48:19-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3796754623.2021
Area: South River - Burk's Falls, Bayfield Inlet - Dunchurch, Western Algonquin Park - Lake of Two Rivers, Huntsville - Baysville, Town of Parry Sound - Rosseau - Killbear Park, Oxtongue Lake - Fort Irwin - Northern Haliburton County
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions are expected today. Conditions will improve by the end of the day. A blizzard warning is issued when winds are expected to produce blowing snow with widespread visibilities of 400 metres or less for at least 6 hours. ### Visibility will be suddenly reduced to near zero at times in heavy snow and blowing snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-22T05:24:59-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-21T13:25:59-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0297696358.2021
Area: Kangiqsujuaq - Raglan Lake, Quaqtaq, Kangirsuk
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Extreme Cold Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A very cold air mass will generate extreme wind chill values of minus 38 overnight tonight. ### Extreme cold puts everyone at risk. Extreme cold warnings are issued when very cold temperatures or wind chill creates an elevated risk to health such as frost bite and hypothermia. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-21T18:59:42-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-21T03:35:42-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0961655291.2021
Area: Manic-5 area, Manic-3 area, Chutes-des-Passes - Pipmuacan Reservoir area, Labrieville area
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Weather Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Winter Weather Travel Advisory in effect for tonight into Thursday morning. Lake enhanced snow will continue over the northern shore of Lake Superior tonight into tomorrow morning with total snowfall amounts of 10 - 15 cm possible. This snow combined with winds gusting up to 60 km/h could result in significantly reduced visibilities in snow and blowing snow. Difficult winter travel conditions are expected, particularly along Highway 17. Slow down and use caution while driving. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-21T17:59:57-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-21T02:01:57-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0400721515.2021
Area: White River - Dubreuilville
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory Alert Is Being Issued By The Hamlet Of Livelong
properties.Summary:
Description: A Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory has been issued for the Hamlet of Livelong. This advisory is for the entire community of Livelong and for any individuals who may access water the Hamlet of Livelong water system. This advisory is in effect until further notice.

properties.Title: Civil Emergency, Update From Sk Provincial Emergency Communications Centre
properties.Summary:
Description: This emergency advisory alert is being issued for the province of Saskatchewan. All travelers returning from outside of Canada are subject to a mandatory 14 day self isolation order. Violation of the order may result in a fine of 2000 dollars.
Expires: 2021-02-03T12:00:00-06:00

Area: Province of Saskatchewan
properties.Author: SK Provincial Emergency Communications Centre

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Potential for significant snowfall and blowing snow beginning Friday night. Locations: the mid and south Labrador coast. Time span: Friday through the weekend. Remarks: An approaching winter storm is expected to impact the Labrador Coast beginning Friday. The potential exists for a prolonged period of strong winds accompanied by significant amounts of snow that may last through the weekend. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2021-01-22T00:52:37-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-21T08:53:37-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2949114916.2021
Area: Red Bay to L'Anse-au-Clair, Norman Bay to Lodge Bay, Cartwright to Black Tickle, Rigolet and vicinity, Postville - Makkovik
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Easterly winds will gust up to 90 km/h this afternoon and evening. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-22T01:23:25-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-21T09:24:25-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3569611650.2021
Area: Kangiqsujuaq - Raglan Lake
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snow Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Local snow squalls developing this evening. Up to 10 cm of new snowfall will be possible under these snow squalls tonight. There may be a brief break in the snow squalls late overnight before they redevelop over portions of the area Friday morning. The squalls are then expected to last through the day Friday before weakening Friday night. Additional significant snowfall amounts up to 10 cm will be possible again Friday for portions of the area. Travelers should consider changing their travel plans accordingly. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-22T05:52:20-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-21T13:53:20-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2991416164.2021
Area: Innisfil - New Tecumseth - Angus, Shelburne - Mansfield - Northern Dufferin County
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snow Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow squalls are expected to develop. Under the snow squall bands, visibilities will be significantly reduced due to the heavy snow combined with blowing snow, and snow will quickly accumulate. Lake effect snow squalls are expected to develop this afternoon. Up to 15 cm of new snowfall will be possible under these snow squalls before they move south of the area this evening. ### Visibility may be significantly and suddenly reduced to near zero. Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-22T01:48:38-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-21T09:49:38-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3367272278.2021
Area: Midland - Coldwater - Orr Lake, Orillia - Lagoon City - Washago, Barrie - Collingwood - Hillsdale, Port Carling - Port Severn, Bracebridge - Gravenhurst, Bruce Peninsula - Sauble Beach - Tobermory, Owen Sound - Blue Mountains - Northern Grey County

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Winter storm warnings are issued when multiple types of severe winter weather are expected to occur together. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.

properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Significant snowfall and potential for blowing snow tonight to Saturday morning. Locations: the Great Northern Peninsula. Total possible snowfall: 15 to 25 cm. Time span: Overnight tonight through to Saturday morning. Remarks: Snow is expected to begin overnight tonight and persist through Friday and Friday night. The bulk of the snow is expected Friday afternoon and Friday night. Moderate northwesterly winds will develop on Friday, occasionally reducing visibility in blowing snow over exposed areas. Winds will shift to moderate southwesterlies on Friday night, causing another period of blowing snow over exposed areas. Conditions are expected to improve Saturday morning. At this time, there is a possibility that more snow and wind will develop again on Saturday night. This scenario is currently very uncertain and more details will be provided in subsequent forecasts. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2021-01-22T00:44:30-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-21T08:45:30-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1149918351.2021
Area: Northern Peninsula East, Port Saunders and the Straits
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Weather Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Winter Weather Travel Advisory in effect for this morning and early afternoon. Lake enhanced snow could result in accumulations of 5 to 10 cm this morning into the early afternoon with heavy snow possible at times. The snow combined with northwest winds possibly gusting up to 70 km/h could result in reduced visibilities in blowing snow. Difficult winter travel conditions are expected, particularly along Highway 17. Slow down and use caution while driving. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.

Area: Sault Ste. Marie - St. Joseph Island

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 15 to 25 cm is expected by Thursday afternoon. Lake enhanced snow will continue tonight along the northern and eastern shores of Lake Superior. This snow combined with winds gusting up 70 km/h could result in blowing snow and considerably reduced visibilities. Travel may become particularly hazardous along Highway 17 between Terrace Bay and Batchawana Bay. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Winter weather expected tonight and Friday. Total snowfall: 10 to 15 cm. Maximum wind gusts: northwesterly near 80 km/h along the coast. Locations: the northeast coast from Clarenville to Green Bay - White Bay, excluding the Bonavista peninsula and Bonavista North. Time span: This evening into Friday afternoon. Remarks: A developing storm south of Nova Scotia will track east of Newfoundland today and Friday. Snow is expected to spread across the northeast coast this evening along with moderate winds, occasionally reducing visibility in blowing snow over exposed areas. On Friday, winds will shift to northwesterly and intensify, especially along Notre Dame Bay and over Fogo Island. Wind and snow will combine to occasionally reduce visibility in blowing snow over exposed areas. Conditions will improve by Friday afternoon. There is still uncertainty regarding snowfall amounts for Green Bay - White Bay. At this time, only 5 to 10 cm is forecast in the area. However, higher amounts are possible over northern portions of the Baie Verte Peninsula. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2021-01-22T00:45:42-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-21T08:46:42-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2061487846.2021
Area: Grand Falls-Windsor and vicinity, Bay of Exploits, Clarenville and vicinity, Gander and vicinity, Green Bay - White Bay, Terra Nova
properties.Author: Environment Canada
